title: When should radio stations start playing winter holiday music? - Quora

response.answer_text: Good question! 2020 has been a year like no other. COVID isolations, lack of work in some industries due to layoffs and closures. I wouldn’t be surprised if the beginning of November signals the start of the holiday music rotations for many local radio station markets. Malls are closed, but retailers are still hoping to generate revenue through online shopping opportunities and since these companies may pay for advertising on said radio stations - We could see Christmas Creep on November 1st.
response.upvotes: Answer requested by Jon Michael Marcos

response.answer_text: Here in America, radio stations would often or almost always plays winter holiday music in mid-November, Christmas in July, and before December 25!
I think Thanksgiving is soon enough, but apparently it isn’t to others because it always seems like they crowd the season every year.
response.upvotes: Answer requested by Jon Michael Marcos

response.answer_text: I love holiday music all year round, though I know many people get tired of it during the season. A safe bet would be to start playing holiday music after Halloween through to New Year's.

response.answer_text: They should do it when corporate decides that it intends to change the station’s format after Christmas.
